keyMoments.title: Force Fumi-e Ritual on Citizens
keyMoments.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates, led by Hyouzou, force Fish-Man Island citizens to step on Queen Otohime's image as a loyalty test, threatening those who refuse.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's extremism and their hatred for Otohime's ideals of peace between fish-men and humans.

members.joinCircumstances: Founded the Sun Pirates after freeing slaves from Mary Geoise
Joined Fisher Tiger as a follower

keyMoments.title: Sun Pirates Mentioned in Context of Fisher Tiger
keyMoments.description: The Sun Pirates are introduced as the crew founded by Fisher Tiger after he freed fish-men slaves from the World Nobles.
keyMoments.significance: The Sun Pirates represent Fisher Tiger's philosophy and are crucial to understanding Jinbe and Arlong's history.

jollyRoger.description: A sun symbol used to cover the branding marks of former slaves

keyMoments.title: Nami Confronts Jinbe About Arlong
keyMoments.description: Nami, with Sanji's support, confronts Jinbe about his role in sending Arlong to the East Blue.
keyMoments.significance: This confrontation connects the Straw Hats' personal history with Fish-Man Island's broader story.

keyMoments.title: Robin Discovers Joy Boy's Poneglyph
keyMoments.description: Robin discovers an important Poneglyph containing Joy Boy's apology letter.
keyMoments.significance: Advances the Straw Hats' quest to understand the world's true history.

jollyRoger.description: A skull wearing a straw hat with crossed bones behind it

members.joinCircumstances: King of Fish-Man Island and the Ryugu Kingdom
Queen of Fish-Man Island, advocated for peace with humans
Eldest son and heir to the throne

keyMoments.title: Queen Otohime's Memory Desecrated
keyMoments.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates force citizens to step on Queen Otohime's image, desecrating her memory.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the ongoing conflict between Otohime's ideals and the New Fish-Man Pirates' extremism.

keyMoments.title: Queen Otohime Introduced as Historical Figure
keyMoments.description: Jinbe introduces Queen Otohime as one of two legendary figures who tried to change Fish-Man Island's history.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Otohime's crucial role in Fish-Man Island's past and her influence on current events.

jollyRoger.description: Royal crest of the Neptune Family
